pageContext.claim: “I don't know if you saw it, the court just ruled that the money I took was taken legally, so at least we have a legal wall.”
pageContext.analysis: That was one appeals court, the 5th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, which ruled 2-1 that El Paso County and the nonprofit Border Network for Human Rights did not have the standing to go against the administration’s plan to take $3.6 billion from more than 100 military construction projects and that neither plaintiff was able to prove they were harmed by the plan. But the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals earlier had ruled that the transfer of funds was illegal. The Supreme Court has already agreed to review that ruling, meaning the question of legality is not settled.
